diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of nasopharyngeal carcinoma was supported by a CT scan revealing ill-defined enhancing mass lesions at the right nasopharyngeal roof and enlarged lymph nodes. The biopsy showed two components: non-keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, with specific immunohistochemical findings and positivity for Epsteinâ€“Barr encoding region.
